title: Homepage
content: When I am done with a website like when I'm done streaming in Discovery+ and I exit out my Firefox homepage doesn't come up, it just exits out of all
creator: aeriss56

title: Typing in a URL uses unwanted URL
content:
When I type "map" into the search bar, firefox loads a website i never use called https://maphappy.org/ while my intent is to load a search for the map feature in google. I have no idea how to clear this behavior without deleting my entire search history.

So what I am asking or requesting is - is there a way to selectively delete search suggestion history as such?

TIA
creator: keny1

title: Account creation and signing in
content: Hello, I'm relatively new to Firefox. I migrated from chrome when they decided to disable ad-blockers. I transferred the 2 accounts i use the most, my personal and school account. My school uses a different email address to the official department of education email provided by most schools in my area. Now recently, my school has decided to transfer everything to the official email and disable the school made email. I went to the about profiles page and pressed create account. I tried creating a new account and it didn't work. i forget the error message given. I went to my school and they said that it's already made, you just need to sign in. I tried and it gave me an error message saying 'Primary account required for sign in' I know the email and had my password reset to the default an it still isn't working. What can I do?
creator: Dev.Mehta

title: Firefox fails
content: 'When I try to open up my firefox account, it opens firefox and locks my computer so that it is frozen. Moving the mouse moves the pointer but anything I click on does not function. When I open the task manager I can end the firefox task and the firefox web page disappears. However, the computer still fails to respond when I click on any functions. If I power down the computer and restart it then everyrthing else seems to function normally. But if I go back into firefox it freezes up again. I got an error message from firefox and it said to restart which I did but that did not work.
creator: beckyandniels

title: Can not enter secondary email address.
content: I want to change my primary Firefox account email. According to the instructions, I need to first enter my secondary email, but when I do that I get a message it already exist. However, under secondary email it always reads "None". How do I get out of this loop so I can change my email settings? Thank you.
creator: fredsaid

title: History locked in time
content:
Websites browsing history does not update or delete. Opening the sidebar, right clicking on an entry and using Forget About this site or Delete Page has no effect. Menu>Settings>Privacy. Private is unchecked. I've selected Clear History Time Range Everything, all boxes checked. Settings When closed Firefox should delete all boxes checked.

Remember Browsing History and it doesn't update when I open the sidebar. Last Visited is the only selection that shows any sites and it doesn't update as I browse new sites. By Date and Site, Most Visited, by site, by date do not show any sites.

I've even uninstalled Firefox and reinstalled and not sure how but it has the same history as well as last tabs opened.
creator: cg1123

title: Support phone number?
content: My friend has been having issues with her account after getting a new PC. She is looking for a Mozilla support phone number or email, and has asked me to post on the forum. We've been through the self help portal and looked around all over the contact page. Any pointers are appreciated.
creator: sapphiremacaw

title: Mozilla Won't Open after Uninstall/Reinstall and Allowed through Firewall
content: The cat walked on my laptop, and pressed F7 for caret browsing. Firefox wouldn't respond to "no" for the Caret Browsing popup, so I closed firefox, and it refused to open again. After three uninstall/installs and making sure it can pass through my firewall, it still won't open.
creator: Maziedoss

title: "Don't enable HTTPS-Only Mode" is selected, but ignored, Vers 106.0.5
content:
"Don't enable HTTPS-Only Mode" is selected, but ignored, Vers 106.0.5

Still keeps adding "s" to http. A program that I use does not support this. Please tell me how to override the https function, and have my websites come up as http:// only.

This issue was posted back in July of this year; however, the answer/response was emailed directly to the person asking the question, so I am having to repost.
creator: Vyky23

title: Why are you denying me access to my Lowes account
content: Why are you denying me access to my Lowes account? I can go to Edge and login to my Lowes Account but Firefox denies me access.
